page.title: 14HARVEST FESTIVAL IN WILDEN.
page.content: Saturday, and the PCC ladies arrive at church carrying boxes of produce, and fistfuls of flowers. By lunch time, the church is overflowing with floral arrangements, and pungeant with the smell of apples and polish. Sunday evening, and the service begins with the choir processing up the aisle singing "We plough the fields & scatter." The church is full. The farming community is indeed thankful. Monday morning. The ladies arrive to take the produce to the Village Hall for auction, and make apple into pies for the Harvest Supper. Potatoes are baked, meat cooked, salads prepared. Tressel tables are laid. 7.30pm. People assemble. The kitchen is alive with bustling ladies and clattering plates.8.30pm. Washing up while people hear group singing. Auction follows. Harvest time is over.
